# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here's how you can solve the problem using Julia programming language.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it, which is the year and month of each DateTime in `dt` concatenated into an integer format: “yyyymm”. The function uses the map function from the DataFrames.jl package to iterate over each element in the DateTimes column (represented by `df[:dt]`), applies the Dates.year and Dates.month functions, and combines them into a single value using arithmetic operations.

To use this function on your DataFrame, you would do:
```julia
add_yearmonth(your_dataframe)
```
where `your_dataframe` is the name of your DataFrame. This will mutate your original DataFrame in-place to add a new column with the year and month values as integers.
